title: Admin bottom nav cleanup, logout restoration, and clock label fix

requirements.summary: Remove Settings from the fixed admin bottom navigation while keeping the Settings section reachable via the admin grid menu.
acceptanceCriteria: In the admin panel bottom navigation (frontend/src/features/admin/components/AdminBottomNav.tsx), there is no button/tab labeled “সেটিংস” and no nav item with id 'settings'.
Admin Settings (SystemSettingsSection) remains reachable via an existing entry point (e.g., AdminGridMenu tile continues to navigate to 'settings').
No runtime TypeScript errors occur due to removing the 'settings' nav item (e.g., grid column counts and active state logic remain valid).

file_operations.description: Remove the Settings nav item (id 'settings') from the bottom nav items array; update icon imports accordingly and adjust the grid column count to match the remaining number of buttons to prevent layout/active-state issues.

requirements.summary: Enlarge admin bottom navigation buttons, add visible borders, and increase the overall bar height so the larger buttons fit comfortably.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin bottom navigation buttons have noticeably larger tap targets (increased padding/min-height) compared to the current implementation.
Each admin bottom navigation button has a clear border in both active and inactive states.
The admin bottom navigation container provides enough vertical space so labels/icons do not look cramped or clipped on common mobile widths.

file_operations.description: Adjust Tailwind classes for the bottom nav container and buttons: increase container vertical padding/height, increase per-button min-height/padding, and add explicit border styling for both active and inactive button states (ensuring borders remain visible on gradients).
Update the admin layout bottom padding (currently pb-20) to ensure content is not obscured by the taller bottom nav after the button size/height increase.

requirements.summary: Restore visible Logout controls in both Admin and User panels, using existing session/logout mechanisms and clearing cached state on logout.
acceptanceCriteria: Admin panel header (frontend/src/features/admin/components/AdminLayoutShell.tsx) includes a Logout control that logs the admin out (clears session) and returns the app to the logged-out state.
User dashboard header (frontend/src/features/user/UserDashboard.tsx) includes a Logout control that logs the user out (clears session) and returns the app to the logged-out state.
The admin header’s newly added replacement button is removed from the header area as requested, and the restored Logout control is present instead.
Logging out clears cached UI state where applicable (e.g., session removed from localStorage and React Query cache cleared via existing SessionProvider logic).

file_operations.description: Add a Logout control to the admin header actions using the existing SessionProvider logout logic (via useSession) so it clears the saved session and React Query cache; remove any header action that was previously introduced as a replacement for logout (if present in this file) so only the restored logout behavior remains.

Add a Logout control in the user dashboard header (e.g., right-side header action) wired to SessionProvider logout (via useSession) so it clears localStorage session and React Query cache, returning the app to the logged-out flow.

requirements.summary: Remove incorrect stray labels near the clock/time display so only time/date are shown, without affecting MT Loan functionality elsewhere.
acceptanceCriteria: No UI region intended to show the current time (e.g., the ClockCard in frontend/src/features/user/components/ClockCard.tsx and its surrounding layout) displays strings like “MT-LOAN”, “MT Loan”, or “HMT”.
The clock component continues to show a live-updating time and date without extra, unrelated labels.
The fix does not remove MT Loan functionality elsewhere (only removes the incorrect/stray label from the time area).

file_operations.description: Ensure the ClockCard renders only the formatted time and formatted date (no extra label text); remove/avoid any hardcoded or derived strings that could introduce “MT-LOAN”, “MT Loan”, or “HMT” into the time area while keeping the live update interval intact.

Audit and adjust the immediate ClockCard surrounding layout so no additional header/label text is injected adjacent to the clock display (ensuring MT Loan-related text remains confined to its own dedicated controls elsewhere).
